column1: #Text=The dive site Cathedral is an offshore rocky reef with coral on the Aliwal shoal , near Umkomaas in the Kwa-Zulu-Natal province of South Africa .
#Text=This is one of the deeper reef sites at Aliwal , and is quite spectacular .
#Text=The site can only be accessed by boat .
#Text=It is site is about 7.2km from the launch site at Mkomazi river mouth or 6km out from Scottburgh main beach .
#Text=This site is in a Marine Protected Area .
#Text=Maximum depth is about 29m . and the top of the surrounding reef is about 24m .
#Text=Cathedral is a big roundish hole on the northern seaward side of the shoal , featuring a rock bridge over one side .
#Text=The hole is several metres deep and maybe 20m wide .
#Text=Rocky reef to the north gets shallower in places .

#Text=Raggy or tasseled scorpionfish , Paperfish , Yellowmouth moray , Salt and pepper moray , Honeycomb moray , Goldie , Striped eel-catfish , Domino , Coachman , Emperor angelfish , Halfmoon rockcod , Whitespot butterflyfish , Clown triggerfish , Yellow snappers .

#Text=Encrusting hard corals , Staghorn hard corals , Branched black corals , Red sea fan with purple polyps , Yellow whip coral , Branching soft corals , Green tree coral , Thistle soft coral , Striped and spotted anemone , Orange lacy false corals , Lacy white bryozoans , Dead man 's fingers , Peacock mantis shrimp , Cleaner shrimps , Lobster , Blue-green sponge , Brown wall sponge , Grey volcano sponge , Yellow tip granular stars , Light brown starfish , Brown feather stars , Brown and orange spiky starfish , Nudibranchs , Spanish dancer .
#Text=The site is regularly cleaned and surveyed by Crystal Divers as part of Project AWARE 's Adopt a Divesite campaign .
#Text=Big round pothole at the edge of the tabular reef , with a stone bridge on the east side .
#Text=When the visibility is sufficient in winter , this site allows good photography of sharks .
#Text=The site is also excellent for macro-photography .
#Text=During winter do not only focus on the sharks .
#Text=Observe all the other sea life around the site including shrimps , colourful nudibranchs and many fish .
#Text=There may be sharks , as this is one of the main attractions of Aliwal shoal , but the Ragged tooth shark is not considered a significant hazard to divers if not molested or startled .
#Text=During winter , several ragged-tooth sharks inhabit the Cathedral .
#Text=Be careful not to startle , threaten or touch these sharks .
#Text=Conventional recreational dive gear is sufficient for diving this site .
#Text=A DSMB may be useful if you have to ascend away from the dive leader .
